nodes.bodyText:
You don't need the generics, just declare the parameter as HasMetadata resource. It would also be good to add javadoc. It wasn't immediately clear to me that the resource is something like KafkaConnector. And name probably isn't the best name for the 2nd parameter (the name of what?)
Finally I think the method name would be clearer with 'allow' it in, since this policy is allowing access

nodes.bodyText:
So as i can see basically you change all our Kafka CR methods is a way that every time when we deploy for instance KafkaConnect, it must be with the additional parameter allowNetworkPolicyAccess. Would it be better to overload  method and encapsulate default value of allowNetworkPolicyAccess?
Currently -> You have only these master methods with lot of parameters.

`public static DoneableKafkaConnect kafkaConnect(String name, int kafkaConnectReplicas, boolean allowNetworkPolicyAccess)`

Goal -> Master method with auxiliary methods like 

1) public static DoneableKafkaConnect kafkaConnect(String name, int kafkaConnectReplicas, boolean allowNetworkPolicyAccess)
2) public static DoneableKafkaConnect kafkaConnect(String name, int kafkaConnectReplicas)

where is second example you will need to decide has default value for the third argument of method in a 1).
Does it make sense?
This one i would move to KubeClusterResource class what do you think @Frawless ?

I think this is too wide. This will open the network even for the CO and therefore the tests will not really test that the CO is able to deal with this on its own. I think you need to make this more specific to allow only connections for the tests.

If I read the code right, this does not allow or disable the network policies. Thsi is rather a swicth between default-to-allow and default-to-deny network policies. So I think we should change the name to make it more clear.

Again, the naming here might be confusing since it doesn't deny or allow network policies. It basically just defines their default behaviour if they are already enabled. If they are disabled, this will do nothing.
